fields.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.
Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.
Contains a unique identifier for the Interest and Late Fee Calculation Rule.
When Use On-Account Amount is set to true, any on-account amount a customer may have will be applied to their delinquent invoices before calculating any interest or late fees.
Set the Include Partial Month flag to yes to calculate a finance charge for the entire month even if the month has already started.

Enter the minimum number of days for a past due invoice to generate a finance charge. As an example, the minimum days is defined as 15, an invoice eligible for finance charges is eligible for 1 full month of interest, however, an invoice generated on the 20th is not eligible.
The number of days in a year to be used in finance charge calculations.
Contains a unique identifier for the Interest and Late Fee Calculation Rule.
The order in which this rule will be applied.  Rules take precedence in ascending order.
The Company the Interest and Late Fee Rule will apply to.
When Use On-Account Amount is set to true, any on-account amount a customer may have will be applied to their delinquent invoices before calculating any interest or late fees.

Company_Reference.description: The Company the Interest and Late Fee Rule will apply to.

Days_in_Year.description: The number of days in a year to be used in finance charge calculations.

Include_Partial_Month.description: Set the Include Partial Month flag to yes to calculate a finance charge for the entire month even if the month has already started.

Interest_and_Late_Fee_Calculation_Option.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.
Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Interest_and_Late_Fee_Calculation_Rule_f.description: Contains a unique identifier for the Interest and Late Fee Calculation Rule.
Contains a unique identifier for the Interest and Late Fee Calculation Rule.

Minimum_Days_For_Partial_Month.description: Enter the minimum number of days for a past due invoice to generate a finance charge. As an example, the minimum days is defined as 15, an invoice eligible for finance charges is eligible for 1 full month of interest, however, an invoice generated on the 20th is not eligible.

Order.description: The order in which this rule will be applied.  Rules take precedence in ascending order.

Tenant_Use_On-Account_Amount.description: When Use On-Account Amount is set to true, any on-account amount a customer may have will be applied to their delinquent invoices before calculating any interest or late fees.

Use_On-Account_Amount.description: When Use On-Account Amount is set to true, any on-account amount a customer may have will be applied to their delinquent invoices before calculating any interest or late fees.
